articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Federal prison guard in Texas pleads guilty in bribery case
articles.description: HOUSTON (AP) — A federal prison guard in Texas faces up to 15 years behind bars for smuggling drugs and electronic devices to inmates at a Houston-area lockup. Jacoby Derrell Randall of Houston pleaded guilty Monday to bribery of a federal employee. Investiga…

articles.author: John Burnett
articles.title: Big Money As Private Immigrant Jails Boom
articles.description: The Trump administration wants to expand its network of immigrant jails. In recent months, Immigration and Customs Enforcement has called for five new detention facilities to be built and operated by private prison corporations across the country. Critics are…

articles.title: Lawmakers, advocates rally to support Salvadoran family split apart at U.S.-Mexico border
articles.description: The nightmare began four years ago for Ana and her family, when the brutal MS-13 gang killed her husband in their native El Salvador. The family had been the target of shakedowns and assault by the gang, and the tormenting only continued after the murder. She…

articles.author: Matthew Rettenmund
articles.title: The Queens' Messenger: A Brief History Of LGBTQ Characters, People, Mentions & Moments On (Mostly Primetime) U.S. TV — 1920s-2000
articles.description: LGBTQ people and issues — and how they've been dealt with on (mostly) U.S. television in (almost exclusively) primetime.
